==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|白|酒}}

===Etymology 1===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=しろざけ|白|tr1=shiro|t1=white|酒|tr2=sake|t2=liquor}}. The ''sake'' changes to ''zake'' due to {{rendaku|しろざけ}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|しろざけ|yomi=k}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しろざけ}}

# a [[white]], [[unfiltered]], [[sweet]], and sometimes thick [[porridge]]-like [[ferment]]ed [[liquor]] made from [[rice]]; traditionally served at {{m|ja|雛祭り|tr=Hina matsuri}} and other festivals
# alternate name for {{m|ja|濁酒|tr=doburoku}}, {{m|ja|濁り酒|tr=nigorizake}}: [[white]] [[unfiltered]] and [[sweet]] [[sake]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|thick sake served at festivals}} {{ja-r|山川酒|やまがわざけ}}
* {{sense|unfiltered sake}} {{ja-r|濁酒|じょくしゅく}}, {{ja-r|濁酒|だくしゅ}}, {{ja-r|濁酒|どぶろく}}
* {{sense|unfiltered sake}} {{ja-r|濁り酒|にごりざけ}}

===Etymology 2===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=しろき|白|tr1=shiro|t1=white|酒|tr2=ki|t2=liquor}}. The ''ki'' reading for {{l|ja|酒}} is archaic.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|しろき|yomi=k}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しろき}}

# white [[ferment]]ed [[liquor]] made from [[rice]], used as an [[offering]] at [[Shinto]] rituals
#: Fermented from specially selected rice, with half used as ''shiroki'' and half mixed with [[incense]] [[ash]] and used as ''kuroki'' ({{m|ja|黒酒}}). Used in particular at the {{m|ja|大嘗祭|tr=daijōsai}} and {{m|ja|新嘗祭|tr=nīnamesai}} rituals held in late November, wherein the [[emperor]] would [[beseech]] the [[god]]s for a good [[harvest]] in the year to come.

=====See also=====
* {{ja-r|黒酒|くろき}}: black [[liquor]]
* {{ja-r|大嘗祭|だいじょうさい}}, {{ja-r|新嘗祭|にいなめさい}}: Shinto rituals wherein the emperor prays for a good harvest in the year to come

===Etymology 3===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=しろささ|白|tr1=shiro|t1=white|酒|tr2=sasa|t2=liquor}}. The ''sasa'' reading for {{l|ja|酒}} is a {{l|ja|女房詞|tr=''nyōbōshi''}}, a term only used by women.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|しろささ|yomi=k}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しろささ}}

# a {{m|ja|女房詞|tr=nyōbōshi}} or "women's word" for ''shirozake''

===Etymology 4===
From {{etyl|zhx|ja}} {{m|zh|白酒}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|はくしゅ|yomi=o}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|はくしゅ}}

# generic term for ''nigorizake'', ''doburoku'', ''shirozake''

=====Usage notes=====
This reading using the [[on'yomi]] is considered slightly more formal, rather like how words in English that have Latin or Greek roots are considered slightly more formal than synonyms that have Anglo-Saxon roots.

=====See also=====
* {{ja-r|濁り酒|にごりざけ}}
* {{ja-r|濁酒|どぶろく}}

===Etymology 5===
From modern {{etyl|zh|ja}} {{m|zh|白酒|tr=báijiǔ}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|ぱいちゅう}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ぱいちゅう|パイチュー}}

# Chinese [[distill]]ed [[liquor]]

=====Usage notes=====
This reading is more often spelled in [[katakana]] as {{l|ja|パイチュー}} to differentiate from the default ''hakushu'' [[on'yomi]] for these characters.
